means: 掠夺，抢劫( despoil的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: They despoiled the villagers of their belongings.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们夺走了村民的财物.

sentence.Network_en: The victorious army despoiled the city of all its treasures.
sentence.Network_cn: 得胜的军队把城里的财宝劫掠一空.

sentence.Network_en: The victorious army despoiled the city of many priceless treasures.
sentence.Network_cn: 战胜的军队抢夺了那城市的许多无价之宝.

PerfectNetExp.abs: They despoiled the villagers of their belongings ., 他们夺走了村民的财物.

list.abs: The cities of Greece and asia were despoiled of their most valuable ornaments ., 希腊和亚洲城市中最值钱的装饰品被抢劫一空.
The foreign troops despoiled Colombia of the Isthmus of Panama ., 外国军队夺走了哥伦比亚的巴拿马地峡.
despiteously 可鄙地despoil of 掠夺despoil 夺取
They despoiled the villagers of their belongings ., 他们夺走了村民的财物.

entry.def: To despoil a place means to make it less attractive, valuable, or important by taking things away from it or by destroying it.

example.ex: ...a landscape despoiled by coal-mining and heavy industry.
example.tran: 遭到煤矿开采和重工业破坏的景观

means.word_mean: 1. having been robbed and destroyed by force and violence;

auth_sentence.content: Her ruling passion had in a manner despoiled her of her humanity.
auth_sentence.res_content: Her ruling passion had in a manner despoiled her of her humanity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her ruling passion had in a manner despoiled her of her humanity.

auth_sentence.content: The cities of Greece and Asia were despoiled of their most valuable ornaments.
auth_sentence.res_content: The cities of Greece and Asia were despoiled of their most valuable ornaments.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The cities of Greece and Asia were despoiled of their most valuable ornaments.
